--- title: "Polynomial Regression" format: docx engine: knitr editor: source --- ## Example 1 For each regression model, sketch the fitted model. To do this, first write the expression for the fitted model for smokers and the fitted model for non-smokers (e.g., plug in 0 and 1 for the indicator variable). Once you have these two equations, use them to sketch the lines on the provided graph. **Model 1:** $\mu(y|x) = 10 + 1 \mathtt{age} -2 \mathtt{smoker}$ Fitted equation for non-smokers:
Fitted equation for smokers:
::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](08H-mlr-categorical_files/figure-docx/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=60%} ::: ::: **Model 2:** $\mu(y|x) = 5 + 1 \mathtt{age} -0.5 \mathtt{age \times smoker}$ Fitted equation for non-smokers:
Fitted equation for smokers:
::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](08H-mlr-categorical_files/figure-docx/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png) ::: ::: **Model 3:** $\mu(y|x) = 4 + 0.5 \mathtt{age} + 3\mathtt{smoker} -0.5 \mathtt{age \times smoker}$ Fitted equation for non-smokers:
Fitted equation for smokers:
::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](08H-mlr-categorical_files/figure-docx/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png) ::: :::
